intro: Sphaeranthus brachystachys, commonly known as the short-stalked globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features small, globular flower heads that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, and it produces numerous small, cylindrical fruits. Sphaeranthus brachystachys is adapted to withstand drought conditions and thrives in well-drained soils.
